title: Was Hua Mulan a real historical person in Chinese history? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. She is a real woman in the history. But her true life is different from the movie Hua Mulan. There is a poetry:Ballad of Mulan,which tell her life in detail. There is a English version. Maybe it is not the best one but I hope it can help you. the ballad of mulan click, click, forever click, click; mulan sits at the door and weaves. listen, and you will not hear the shuttle's sound, but only hear a girl's sobs and sighs. “oh tell me, lady, are you thinking of your love, oh tell me, lady, are you longing for your dear?” ”oh no, oh no, i am not thinking of my love, oh no, oh no, i am not longing for my dear. but last night i read the battle-roll; the khan has ordered a great levy of men. the battle-roll was written in twelve books, and in each book stood my father's name. my father's sons are not grown men, and of all my brothers, none is older than me. oh let me to the market to buy saddle and horse, and ride with the soldiers to take my father's place.” in the eastern market she's bought a gallant horse, in the western market she's bought saddle and cloth. in the southern market she's bought snaffle and reins, in the northern market she's bought a tall whip. in the morning she stole from her father's and mother's house; at night she was camping by the yellow river's side. she could not hear her father and mother calling to her by her name, but only the song of the yellow river as its hurrying waters hissed and swirled through the night. at dawn they left the river and went on their way; at dusk they came to the black water's side. she could not hear her

At present, Mulan's authenticity is unknown and cannot be said to be completely fictitious, but its prototype is still controversial. There are historical records of her hometown in Yucheng. For the character of Mulan, we only found clues from the poem "Mulan Ci", but this is only a folk story, and her surname has not been conclusive yet. According to news, the matter of joining the army for his father was only found in poetry. This "Mulan Ci" belongs to "Yuefu Poetry Collection", in addition, the "Mulan Ci" is recorded in the "Recognition of General Portrait of General Xiaolie Martyr's Ancestral Hall" in the Yuan Dynasty, and also in the "Recognition of Correction of General Xiaolie Lie" in the Qing Dynasty. The story of Mulan joining the army. It is said that during the Sui Dynasty, there was a heroine dressed as a man named Hua Mulan. In order to commemorate her, people built the Mulan Temple in Yingguo Town, Yucheng County. During the Qing Dynasty, the temple occupied a lot of land. There are more than 10,000 square meters. There are statues of Mulan riding horses on the inside, and there are murals and other frescoes on the walls. Many of them have poems praising Mulan. If this is just a fictional folk story, it will never Someone has spent so much effort and production, indicating that Mulan has joined the army for his father, and there is a great possibility of history.  Later, Yucheng County, Shangqiu City, Henan Province was called Mulan's hometown, and the names of many stations, shops, and streets were called Mulan.
